title: DirectX issue.
body:
I am having an issue with loading into the game after champ select. The error says "An unknown Directx error has occurred and League of Legends cannot start. Please make sure your video card is using the latest video drivers from the manufacturer."

1. I have the latest driver for my 1050 ti.
2. I have made sure my Directx is up to date.
3. I have deleted the config and info files and had them reinstalled.
4. I have reinstalled the entire client. 
5. I have run an in client repair.

None of these solutions worked. I even reinstalled my windows version to make sure it wasn't an issue with the windows files. Please help.

replies.body:
Make sure you're launching the client as admin and try running a quick repair through the client options. There might just be a couple files corrupted somewhere that just aren't working with DirectX properly, so let's try this first. Test it in a custom/practice game first to avoid any possible leaverbusters from crashing in a normal match. 

If that repair doesn't help at all, go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). It sounds like you've already done plenty of troubleshooting, so in that case, let's get you a little better help!
Yeah, it is a little annoying. Granted it started when I was going into a practice tool mode where I was trying things out, so I didn't get a reported. But I can't play anything.

I've had the same issue. It even hit me with a leaver buster after I loaded back into the client. This is really something that we should be notified of before we get into a game if they're going to punish us for sudden updates.
